sentences: Nad ei hoianud kunagi midagi meiega jagada.
context: The word 'hoidsid' is the past tense (second person singular) form of the Estonian verb 'hoima', which means to keep, hold, store, or preserve. It indicates an action that was done in the past by someone addressing you directly (singular). The verb can refer to physically holding something, keeping information secret, storing items, or maintaining a state over time.
